areaSection: Orihuela Costa is a thriving coastal town in southern Alicante, blessed with over 300 days of annual sunshine and a Mediterranean climate that appeals to retirees seeking consistent warmth. Situated between Torrevieja and Campoamor, Orihuela Costa has evolved from a quiet fishing village into a well-established residential destination famous for its championship golf courses and safe, family-friendly atmosphere. The area's geography features rolling terrain with easy access to dramatic coastline, creating a perfect balance between beach culture and residential tranquility. With a well-developed infrastructure, Spanish and international schools, multiple medical centers, and excellent shopping facilities, Orihuela Costa offers everything needed for comfortable retirement living. The town maintains an authentic Spanish character while embracing its large international community, making it uniquely welcoming to expats seeking a genuine sense of belonging.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Orihuela Costa revolves around a relaxed Mediterranean rhythm perfectly suited to retirement. Your mornings might begin with a walk along one of the nearby Blue Flag beaches, followed by coffee at a local café where you'll likely encounter fellow expats from your home country. The international community here is substantial and well-integrated, with numerous clubs, organizations, and social groups ensuring you're never isolated. Shopping is effortless with Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl supermarkets within minutes, plus the major La Zenia Boulevard shopping center for more extensive retail needs. Healthcare is world-class and accessible, with English-speaking doctors available at local medical centers and major hospitals nearby. The culinary scene blends Spanish tradition with international options, from family-run chiringuitos on the beach to quality restaurants serving cuisines from around the world. Social engagement is natural here—golf clubs, book groups, charity organizations, and beach communities create genuine friendships and sense of purpose.

At €310,000, you're acquiring a property 35% below the price per square meter of equivalent Costa Blanca North properties, positioning you advantageously for future appreciation. Hospital de Torrevieja, just 15 minutes away, is a major regional facility offering comprehensive emergency and specialist services. For private healthcare, Quirónsalud hospital in nearby Benidorm provides premium facilities with English-speaking consultants. Local medical centers throughout Orihuela Costa employ multilingual staff familiar with treating expat communities, offering convenient access to GPs, dentists, and specialists. Pharmacies are abundant and well-stocked, with English-speaking pharmacists available. Spain's healthcare system combines excellent quality with affordability, and private insurance options are accessible and reasonably priced for retirees.
